comments:
I'm using 3.2RC2.
- i was deleting all of org.eclipse.* plugins
- while this was running in the background I changed the target platform
==> clicking OK in the preferences, I got the following NullPointerException:


java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.bundle.WorkspaceBundleModel.getInstallLocation(WorkspaceBundleModel.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.bundle.BundlePluginModelBase.getInstallLocation(BundlePluginModelBase.java:202)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.MinimalState.addBundle(MinimalState.java:102)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.preferences.TargetPluginsTab$5.run(TargetPluginsTab.java:658)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.preferences.TargetPluginsTab.performOk(TargetPluginsTab.java:645)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.preferences.TargetPlatformPreferencePage.performOk(TargetPlatformPreferencePage.java:589)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog$11.run(PreferenceDialog.java:889)

crazy talk!

I updated the code to be a bit more fullproof regarding this issue as the getLocation() contract does state that it can come back null.
